properties.areaDesc: Coastal Waters of Northern USVI and Culebra out 10 NM; Caribbean Waters of Puerto Rico from 10 NM to 17N; Coastal Waters of Southern USVI, Vieques, and Eastern Puerto Rico out 10 NM; Anegada Passage Southward to 17N
properties.headline: Small Craft Advisory issued February 7 at 4:17AM AST until February 9 at 8:00AM AST by NWS San Juan PR
properties.description:
...ROUGH AND HAZARDOUS MARINE CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL THROUGH THE
WEEKEND...

.A strong surface high pressure across the central Atlantic will yield
a fresh to locally strong easterly wind flow across the regional
waters, creating choppy and hazardous marine conditions through the
weekend.

* WHAT...Seas between 5 to 7 feet with occasional seas up to 9
feet and easterly winds at 20 kt. Winds across the Caribbean
offshore waters are ranging between 20 and 25 kt with higher
gusts.

* WHERE...Coastal Waters of Northern USVI and Culebra out 10 NM,
Anegada Passage Southward to 17N, Coastal Waters of Southern
USVI Vieques and Eastern Puerto Rico out 10 NM and Caribbean
Waters of Puerto Rico from 10 NM to 17N.

* WHEN...From 8 AM this morning to 8 AM AST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Conditions will be hazardous to small craft.
properties.instruction:
Inexperienced mariners, especially those operating smaller
vessels, should avoid navigating in hazardous conditions.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 AM AST SUNDAY
